analysis: The documents all pertain to exemptions from mandatory retirement for government employees. They cite the same legal authority (section 204 of the act of June 30, 1932) or similar retirement law and express a judgment that the public interest requires the exemption. The exemptions are typically for one year, though some are for longer periods or extensions. The employees hold various positions across different government departments.
title: Exemptions to Mandatory Retirement for Government Employees
